comments.body: Let's also add comments for FullOuter in: https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/30395/files#diff-6cd66da710d8d54025c1edf658bbec5230e8b4e748f9f2f884a60b1ba1efed42R395

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +403,407 @@          case LeftOuter => rightSideJoiner.removeOldState()
          case RightOuter => leftSideJoiner.removeOldState()
          case FullOuter => Iterator.empty
          case _ => throwBadJoinTypeException()
        }

comments.body:
Nich catch,
nit: let's remove the duplicate error string in https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/29724/files#diff-e9db271d8593f070ba7096e758c8b89dR168 and https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/29724/files#diff-e9db271d8593f070ba7096e758c8b89dR162

@xuanyuanking - sorry that I don't get how to change, are you suggesting to have a string val for error message to be used in `throwBadJoinTypeException ` and `require(...)`: `val errorMessageForJoinType = s"${getClass.getSimpleName} should not take $joinType as the JoinType")`, or something else?
Yes, have a string val for the same error message.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +194,198 @@    case LeftOuter => left.outputPartitioning
    case RightOuter => right.outputPartitioning
    case _ => throwBadJoinTypeException()
  }

comments.body: Just to clarify: this comment is not related to the bug and just to document an existing assumption?

Yes right.

TBH I suspected this first and crafted a patch including the part with new iterator explicitly runs the logic after evaluating innerOutputIter, and later realized current logic already dealt with this properly, because removeOldState() doesn't materialize the candidates and evaluate lazily. This patch contains minimal change.

Worth to mention how it works for someone who may need to touch here.
